data.text:
"Everybody should be afforded the opportunity to dream & become everything their imagination desires." 

Disability activist & SDG advocate @eddiendopu spoke about his work promoting a more inclusive world with @MelissaFleming on 'Awake At Night'. https://t.co/AUZYrmghlw https://t.co/rhKxyUYMsj

In many countries, school meals represent a significant portion of children's daily dietary intake. 

A new project launched by @FAO and @WFP aims to further improve nutrition standards for school meals. 🥗 https://t.co/uFVwMt0IIy

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, or war at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/rtosk22X9s via @Refugees https://t.co/LinieTr3NG

"The next hours & days will be critical. The risk of major conflict is real & needs to be prevented at all costs."

-- UN political chief @DicarloRosemary briefing the Security Council on Ukraine. https://t.co/90J8uSLo2G

Healthcare workers have been on the frontlines of the fight against #COVID19, often putting their own well-being at risk due to unsafe working conditions. 

Latest @WHO and @ilo health & safety guidelines aim to protect health workers globally. https://t.co/oFpvo46uHM

Ukraine: @antonioguterres says efforts must be focused on ensuring immediate cessation of hostilities, protection of civilians, preventing any actions & statements that may further escalate situation & prioritizing diplomacy.
https://t.co/gnZnOeOwBe https://t.co/RnyTOhsH5J

Afghanistan: Amid massive humanitarian crisis, @UNICEF is providing emergency cash support to public school teachers so girls & boys can continue learning. 

An additional USD $250 million is needed to ensure schools in the country can stay open. https://t.co/tztN9ytMH4

Harsh winter conditions have added to the humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.

Despite challenging conditions, @WFP is committed to reaching even the most remote parts of the country with life-saving food assistance. https://t.co/3bKlecYRkK https://t.co/XQxwPJUPcL

Languages represent who we are. 

Protecting this identity is a matter of human rights.

On Monday's #MotherLanguageDay, let's celebrate the power of linguistic diversity & multilingualism. https://t.co/8DyBnfzM61 via 
@UNESCO https://t.co/CkXOk5UwZV

Racism, discrimination and xenophobia harm us all.

But everyone, everywhere can take action to spread compassion, tolerance and acceptance.

Get ideas about how YOU can help #FightRacism. https://t.co/cCd3Jk32kt https://t.co/01hKbbZSir

Monday is #MotherLanguageDay! 

Cultural and linguistic diversity are key for sustainable and peaceful societies. https://t.co/8DyBnfzM61 via @UNESCO https://t.co/1DIIOLuG8v

The climate emergency can seem daunting, but we have the solutions to solve this crisis. 

From renewable energy to green technologies & individual #ClimateAction steps, all of us can #ActNow to help protect our planet & our future. https://t.co/OY6qiLBq9t https://t.co/B26TXFQUYO

On Monday's #MotherLanguageDay & every day, check out how you can follow the UN in different languages: 

French: @ONU_fr
Spanish: @ONU_es
Arabic: @UNarabic
Russian: @UnitedNationsRU
Hindi: @UNinHindi
Kiswahili: @UmojaWaMataifa
Portuguese: @NacoesUnidas

https://t.co/1Zv0mzzeJN https://t.co/F9bnXKqAId

During @UNEP's 50 years of work, the world has come together to:
🌎 repair the ozone layer, 
🌏 phase out leaded fuel,
🌍 protect endangered species facing extinction.

#UNEP50 is an opportunity for collective #ClimateAction to safeguard people & planet. https://t.co/Pd1lWOasE1

The climate crisis & conflict are inextricably linked.

In some of the world's most challenging environments, @UNPeacekeeping is working to protect the vulnerable while also minimizing the missions' environmental footprint & taking #ClimateAction. https://t.co/cJFKNb9v1O https://t.co/j9JTgnL1Iz

Holocaust distortion threatens societies, and disrespects victims & survivors.

To protect their legacies, we must #ProtectTheFacts about the Holocaust. https://t.co/uJ3Y1FoTkg https://t.co/NW0VdTyXhZ

Social justice is only possible when all barriers people face based on gender, race, ethnicity, religion, culture or disability are removed. 

Sunday is #SocialJusticeDay. https://t.co/uwnxdxRQhW https://t.co/fbHI6H6xO7

What we share online can have consequences in the real world.

Spreading misinformation during #COVID19 can put lives at risk.

Take a moment and #PledgeToPause and verify facts before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA https://t.co/vJAuhUKpDd

#COVID19 has worsened existing inequalities around the world. 

We need a human-centered response that promotes social justice for everyone, everywhere. 

More on Sunday's #SocialJusticeDay: https://t.co/uwnxdy9rGw https://t.co/HNuUS3XoLL

Biking to work 🚲
Switching off lights 💡
Reducing food waste 🚮
& more!

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 

Chat with us over Facebook @messenger for more ideas on how YOU can #ActNow & help make this a decade of #ClimateAction: https://t.co/SJ27YxCa38 https://t.co/If3Nsuj0Tk

Sunday is #SocialJusticeDay.

The #GlobalGoals are a universal call for social justice that seek to address poverty & inequality to leave no one behind.

https://t.co/FxRibzXuad https://t.co/bx0ia9i9xp

UN peacekeepers from Fiji are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/0uZ71tftll

The Trolls are doing their part to protect our planet & they are asking YOU to become a food hero like them.

🍊🌽🥕🍌🥦

From buying local & seasonal fruits & vegetables to wasting less food, all of us can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #TrollsFoodHeroes https://t.co/kb54gyWjQy

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. Yet racism is a problem in every country.

See how you can take action to #FightRacism and stand up for our common humanity: https://t.co/PWxqEMAxTC https://t.co/MdndzCWEgz

"An absolute crisis is unfolding before our eyes," warns @WFPChief, as 10.5 million people across the Sahel face starvation due to drought, conflict & the impacts of #COVID19.

USD $470 million is needed over the next 6 months to help those in need. https://t.co/Pe84O4zGZv

Haiti: Despite some signs of progress, the country faces serious political, economic & humanitarian challenges, the Security Council heard on Friday. 

4.9 million people - 43% of the country’s population -  will need humanitarian assistance this year. 
https://t.co/BXWDKD3XCJ

"We need a surge in diplomacy for peace, a surge in political will for peace, and a surge in investment for peace."

-- @antonioguterres tells Munich Security Conference. https://t.co/Gi1cBC8fJF https://t.co/rkVJqV7n40

1 out of every 30 people in the world is a migrant, and many of them have been at the forefront of the fight against #COVID19.

As #MigrationWeek is coming to an end, join us in thanking migrants for their contributions and call for a more inclusive world. https://t.co/QDMBrlNuoF https://t.co/fXuQGZQHfX

Billions of girls & women around the world are affected by discriminatory laws that are holding them back.

But if we work together, we can make sure they are #EqualEverywhere. https://t.co/7lMJMe3WJx via @unfoundation https://t.co/vMWI3qE7z0

📸: “Let Us Beat Our Swords into Ploughshares” 

This gift that the USSR gave to the UN in 1959 continues to be a disarmament symbol. 

Learn about out how the UN works to promote the elimination of nuclear & other weapons of mass destruction: https://t.co/HwXwt561Vi https://t.co/IPTYocbLJA

"Multilateralism & global cooperation are vital. Only together can we deliver for the people of the world."

-- @UN_PGA told Parliamentarians from around the world during joint hearing with @IPUparliament at #UNGA. 
https://t.co/cpQiRmTvpX https://t.co/j6DezuMRHN

180 million young people globally live with a physical, sensory or psychosocial disability.

The “Wanted: A World for One Billion” exhibit explores the lives of those who have overcome challenges to advocate for change for future generations. https://t.co/86dsQJrofi https://t.co/vTb4Iok3Pc

"We simply cannot accept even the possibility of a new conflict in Ukraine. 

Indeed, we are facing a test."

-- UN political chief @DicarloRosemary briefing the Security Council on Thursday. 
https://t.co/xMc00okny2

The global response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity.

No act of goodwill is too small. 

#OnlyTogether can we overcome the pandemic. 

https://t.co/GNaQLqWRGJ #RandomActsofKindnessDay https://t.co/zpzhbi70BL

🔴 Deadly wildfires
🔴 Noise pollution in cities
🔴 Disruptions to the rhythm of nature

New @UNEP #Frontiers2022 report identifies looming environmental threats that urgently need attention. #ClimateAction https://t.co/uQR3zwciiL

UN peacekeepers from Fiji are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/cJFtp21n9G

Women's full and equal participation at all levels of society is a fundamental right.

Around the global & across all sectors, women’s leadership continues to be underrepresented. 

See how @UN_Women is working for a more equal world. https://t.co/fJyFQp92MG https://t.co/XT2J74fne2

📷: UN peacekeepers with @UNIFIL_ patrol a snowy landscape in Lebanon.

Around the world, the men & women #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping continue their vital work despite challenging conditions. https://t.co/1AkYG6N3nb https://t.co/qLoyyuIwVD

"Together – and only together – can we safeguard our common humanity & secure the rights & dignity of all."

@antonioguterres tells #UNGA strengthened international cooperation is needed to effectively manage migration & protect rights of all migrants. https://t.co/Duj5bAo9rw https://t.co/pb6BEZo3qL

"Haiti is again at a crossroads. Years of investment in stability & development must be protected."

Six months after a devastating earthquake hit the country, @AminaJMohammed joins others at donor conference to support Haiti's recovery & reconstruction. https://t.co/0JFihx0saS

"We need to act decisively to realize & promote the rights of persons with disabilities in every corner of the world & in every facet of life."

At Global Disability Summit, @antonioguterres calls for a more inclusive, just & sustainable world for all. https://t.co/BloNtPO5rw

The only way to end the #COVID19 crisis is to come together in solidarity, as one human family. 

Together, we can get through the pandemic.
Together, we can rebuild & create a better world for all. 

https://t.co/GNaQLqFgi9 #OnlyTogether https://t.co/dMp85ujTSn

Health concerns, conflict & inequalities are just some of the issues causing people to feel insecure around the world.

@UNDP's latest human security report explores policy approaches that could help create a more stable future for all. https://t.co/rFGa2e18id https://t.co/HOuKIAUY49

Interested in working at the UN? 

The Young Professionals Programme is now open for applications through 27 February.

Get application tips & more from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/hVBgLxpZ1y https://t.co/NU9EHb5ky3

Somalia: Leaders must urgently conclude a credible election process, says top UN official in the country.

Urgent funding needed to address devastating humanitarian crisis brought on by region's worst drought in decades. https://t.co/Rnkn1EagpA

Professionals working for @Refugees bring compassion, dedication & a wide range of expertise when responding to help those in need:  

Protection
Shelter
Site management
Health
Data
Logistics

Here's how you can join their life-saving work at UNHCR: https://t.co/KAyBt0YV08 https://t.co/vNA9j3kM6C

For 70+ years, @UNmigration has been providing critical aid to migrants, promoting safe & regular migration and harnessing the potential of human mobility.

This #MigrationWeek, find out more about IOM's work for people on the move: https://t.co/d9ApqfMy2X https://t.co/0mu64X7Yuc

Fiji provides military & police officers to seven @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world.

We thank these brave men & women, who have continued their important protection work, even amid the challenges posed by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/9mQYOmiOuV

Regular physical activity benefits many aspects of our lives:

🏃improved health 
💪 disease prevention 
🧠increased mental well-being

More from @WHO on why every move counts! https://t.co/TbBZahWX5j #BeActive

 https://t.co/G4SZ6SvjlC

Just released: @africarenewal's first podcast episode with @JoyKategekwa.

She discusses how the African free trade area can benefit the continent & help achieve the #GlobalGoals. 

Take a listen! 📣 https://t.co/1hehAcLwIq https://t.co/s59o0pKnh0

"The time is now to defuse tensions & de-escalate actions on the ground."

Amid heightened tensions around Ukraine, @antonioguterres stresses there is no alternative to diplomacy. https://t.co/TGYxquBiyO https://t.co/GXDuYDjIvi

The impacts of the climate crisis harm people's health through air pollution, disease, extreme weather events, food insecurity & more.  

Every year, environmental factors result in about 13 million deaths.

We need to #ActNow to protect people & planet. https://t.co/4pc9fNvWvI https://t.co/ipzY9Hb54Q

The @JointSDGFund has announced it will invest an additional $54.5 million in projects supporting the #GlobalGoals across five countries.

From the #COVID19 recovery to the climate crisis, the investments will respond to the challenges of our time. https://t.co/FvCtvX5fO8

Most cases of childhood cancer can be cured. But inequalities in early detection, diagnosis & treatment result in a disproportionate number of deaths in low- & middle-income countries.

More from @pahowho on Tuesday's International Childhood Cancer Day. https://t.co/LheZDhzqzq https://t.co/OZL8Wo9uzn

"We simply cannot accept even the possibility of such a disastrous confrontation."

Amid heightened tensions around Ukraine, @antonioguterres stresses there is no alternative to diplomacy. https://t.co/CbYu6vOw4K https://t.co/xuQWrX2skV
#LoveIsLove: On Monday's #ValentinesDay, join UN @free_equal & support fair treatment of lesbian, gay, bi, trans & intersex people everywhere. https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag https://t.co/wIZPvhFScz

2 billion people on this planet don't have enough food.

But YOU can help! 🍚

Check out https://t.co/m1YJym2Xxk -- where every correct answer you give helps @WFP put food on the table of those in need. https://t.co/hZ5TB57iBi

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable world.

This #ValentinesDay, we can all recommit to the 17 Goals and show love to our planet & all its people. https://t.co/Ss4uMcXdcV https://t.co/0IW0EKgEwK

People around the world are coming to terms with the ways in which the climate emergency is impacting their daily lives. 

@UNFCCC explains how we can tackle the climate crisis & built a better future for all if we #ActNow. https://t.co/SQ4ukKfjcd https://t.co/CTB00lJhNT

The climate crisis is about how people are impacted when it comes to education, gender equality, poverty, hunger, peace & health.

-- @vanessa_vash, one of the 2020 Young Leaders for the #GlobalGoals, explains why #ClimateAction matters. 
https://t.co/M9lpg6t9kj https://t.co/miDaewFPbm

Epilepsy affects around 50 million people worldwide. It's a treatable, neurological disease characterized by recurrent seizures, or brief episodes of involuntary movement.

Monday is World Epilepsy Day: https://t.co/CF1CZbxRqA https://t.co/TpAbUkZ56d

Canada provides military & police officers to six @UNPeacekeeping missions.

We thank these brave women & men, who have continued their important protection work even amid the challenges posed by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/XxU7znFAEJ

"Everyone needs to play their part in reducing their opportunity to get infected and to spread this virus." -- @WHO's @mvankerkhove.

More tips on how to keep you & your loved ones safe amid #COVID19: https://t.co/VJFhT1FDQM https://t.co/H5gpCUiW0Y

Despite unparalleled advancements around the world, conflict, inequalities & health challenges continue to cause people anxiety about their future. 

Latest report from @UNDP proposes new approaches to development that could benefit people & planet. https://t.co/yhdEXF1WGd https://t.co/s0pYscZENJ

Radio can
📻 promote dialogue & understanding,
📻 build a sense of community,
📻 allow an exchange of views & solutions. 

More on how radio benefits people & societies around the world on Sunday's #WorldRadioDay. https://t.co/v7RIclv3iC

Mobile clinics in Côte D'Ivoire. 
Drone-delivered vaccines in Ghana.
African countries are creative in fight against #COVID19.

"The continent is full of good ideas to get vaccines into arms. Let’s help do that, for all our sakes," says @MelissaFleming. https://t.co/ouS1V8kEhh

Radio is one of the most accessible media in the world, and amid #COVID19, it has been key to ensure continuity of learning & to fight misinformation. 

More on Sunday's #WorldRadioDay: https://t.co/v7RIcldrU2 via @UNESCO https://t.co/VUpKGoyu1U

"We can end the pandemic this year.

We have the pathway to get there.

But we can only get there together."

-- @antonioguterres joins world leaders calling for $23 billion to support global vaccine equity partnership. https://t.co/OhRxWCBHEu #OnlyTogether https://t.co/ZTTBgjkLC3

Throwback to 1953, when Audrey Hepburn prepared to record a radio programme for @UNICEF.

On Sunday's #WorldRadioDay, we celebrate radio's ability to broaden horizons, build more harmonious societies, and unite & empower people. https://t.co/EkuaWEFO0f https://t.co/kZrIVTIKav

Tonga: Recovery continues following last month's devastating volcanic eruption & tsunami.

UN teams on the ground are gearing up to provide support so people can get back on their feet as quickly and safely as possible. https://t.co/BIkQTydXRS

🌟Equal pay.
🌟More visibility.
🌟Recognition for talent.
🌟Safe playing fields.

#WomenInSport deserve the same treatment & respect that male athletes get. https://t.co/8C6GRgtTcu via @UN_Women https://t.co/YANyzi0h3V

Education is key to changing racist attitudes and behaviours. 

In the classroom and beyond, there must be:

🔹 Equal access to education
🔹 Diversity among educators
🔹 Racism awareness in learning environments

Help #FightRacism: https://t.co/lmBLVk3qxU https://t.co/e4rCxj8plz

.@UNICEF helps children released from armed groups build a new future through education, counseling & training. 

More on Saturday's International Day against the Use of Child Soldiers: https://t.co/AFdeRPlNPp #ChildrenNotSoldiers https://t.co/NU2g6saaLW

Interested in ocean affairs and law of the sea? 

The UN - Nippon Foundation Sustainable Ocean Programme Fellowship programme is now accepting applications: https://t.co/MFDE7Mly88 https://t.co/6O3C6GulEd

Tens of thousands of boys & girls are forced to take part in armed conflicts & #COVID19 has further exacerbated the situation. 

It is a grave violation of their human rights. 

Saturday is the Int'l Day against Use of Child Soldiers. https://t.co/kv5tuctnAR #ChildrenNotSoldiers https://t.co/MOuYIoarw8

The international community needs to intensify efforts to #SaveOurOcean, @antonioguterres tells #OneOceanSummit, stressing that a sustainable blue economy can drive economic progress & job creation while protecting the ocean & climate. 
https://t.co/BgUfU9Iq2L

Science has no gender! 🔬🧬🥼🔭

We need to support girls & empower more #WomenInScience to address global challenges & create a better future for all.

Friday is the International Day of Women & Girls in Science. https://t.co/aNVKFKOJDh via @UNESCO https://t.co/BL8Yx5qeoA

"It will be impossible to eradicate poverty without climate justice." 

-- @vanessa_vash, one of the 2020 Young Leaders for the #GlobalGoals, explains why #ClimateAction matters. 
https://t.co/M9lpg6KKbR https://t.co/fuQEXg7Xew

Friday is #WomenInScience Day! 

Let’s smash stereotypes, defy gender bias and defeat discrimination that holds women and girls back in science, tech, engineering and math. 👩‍🔬👩‍🚀 https://t.co/5PSJzVq6su https://t.co/yBB4g47LRf

Every child has the right to grow up free from fear.

The rights of children affected by violence must be safeguarded. 

@UNICEF is working to protect children in conflict zones around the world. 

They are #NotATarget! https://t.co/CgKkL6OYtS https://t.co/bvWVEhR0Sx

Women scientists are under-represented & struggle to get recognition for their achievements, including their invaluable contributions in the fight against the #COVID19 pandemic.

Friday is #WomenInScience Day. https://t.co/5PSJzVq6su https://t.co/pRopNd9w9I

"We don’t have a moment to lose."
The well-being of people, health of our planet & survival of future generations depend on the willingness to come together around a commitment to collective problem-solving & action, @antonioguterres tells #UNGA. https://t.co/pY53SUvxRV https://t.co/1AnJZje8RP

“Don't let anyone tell you that math & science is not for you!" 

-- These leaders in science have an important message about why opening doors for girls & benefits everyone.

Friday is the International Day of Women & Girls in Science. https://t.co/e880uOzfgd #WomenInScience https://t.co/TKW39zQabB

🚉 Using public transport
🚯 Reducing food waste
👚 Buying sustainable fashion

People around the world have already logged more than 5 million of their #ClimateAction activities.

Join the movement & #ActNow: https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/c2c9TYPsqt

Pulses are delicious & good for our health.

They are also #ClimateAction heroes. 

On Thursday's #WorldPulsesDay, @FAO explains why pulses are vital for the future of our food. https://t.co/SQRriDAKYv https://t.co/lc6HlSJywS

Building inclusive societies where everyone can enjoy equal opportunities benefits us all.

Join @UN_Women in working towards #GenerationEquality. https://t.co/9DkJpsP6x9 https://t.co/04inY3cXX5

"We can end the pandemic this year.

We have the pathway to get there.

But we can only get there together."

-- @antonioguterres joins world leaders calling for $23 billion to support global vaccine equity partnership. #OnlyTogether https://t.co/fpPc0Vbrm8
